str2: No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Alone, but, only. Neuter of monos as adverb; merely.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To boast; I glory (exult) proudly. From some base akin to that of aucheo and euchomai; to vaunt.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
Reconciliation, restoration to favor. From katallasso; exchange, i.e. Restoration to favor.
